p: Most of the ingredients in these preparations are aromatic plants that have been used in traditional medicine for centuries (Liang et al., 2004; Bouaziz et al., 2009). The majority are Lamiaceae, such as, Salvia species, intensively studied because of their economic interest for food, cosmetic, and pharmaceutical preparations (Durling et al., 2007; Longaray Delamare et al., 2007; Walch et al., 2011; Orhan et al., 2012). In particular, S. officinalis L. subsp. officinalis and S. officinalis L. subsp. lavandulifolia (Vahl) Gams (syn. S. lavandulifolia Vahl) have been largely investigated due to their biological activities as anti-nociceptive, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant and inhibitor of cholinesterase activity (Bakkali et al., 2008; Adorjan and Buchbauer, 2010; Ramos et al., 2010; Kennedy and Wightman, 2011; Walch et al., 2011). In addition, S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia is the accepted source for the Spanish sage oil in the European Pharmacopoeia (EDQM, 2016) and other standards (AENOR, 2001; ISO, 2005).
